你陷入 &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] 状态，并在你回合结束时重复豁免，成功则终止其身上的该效应。

中毒期间，你陷入 &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] 状态。

Cultist Fanatic.name: 邪教狂信者
Cultist Fanatic.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol (Varies)}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}

Cultists

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.VICfYukXoYkWJ1yn caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Cultist Fanatic

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.DHw4tAz06WzLz07b caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name lowercase]]施展以下一道法术，使用感知作为施法属性（法术豁免 DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]，法术攻击命中 +4）：

随意： @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{光亮术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{奇术}

2/日： @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000]{命令术}

1/日： @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{定身人类}

Spiritual Weapon.name: 灵体武器
Spiritual Weapon.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 施展法术 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]，使用其施法动作的施法属性。

z817Et9IPt6qHawH.name: 灵体武器
z817Et9IPt6qHawH.description:
你创造出一块形似你选择的武器的浮空灵体力场，并使其持续到法术持续时间结束。它出现在施法距离内你选择的一点，并且你可以立即对该武器周围 5 尺内的一个生物发动一次近战法术攻击。若命中，则目标受到 1d8 + 你的施法属性调整值的力场伤害。

在你之后的回合内，你可以以一个附赠动作让该武器移动至多 20 尺，并再对它周围 5 尺内的一个生物发动一次同样的攻击。

升环施法： 使用高于二环的法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比二环高一环，法术的伤害就增加 1d8。

Light.name: 光亮术
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

materials.value: 一只萤火虫或一片磷光苔藓

Thaumaturgy.name: 奇术
Thaumaturgy.description:
你在施法距离内显现一道次级奇迹。你在施法距离内创造下述效应之一。如果你多次施展该法术，则可以同时维持至多三个不同的持续 1 分钟的效应。

改变眼睛。 你改变自己眼睛的外观，其效应持续 1 分钟。

扩音。 你的声音变为一般时候的三倍，其效应持续 1 分钟。在此期间，你在 [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] 检定上具有优势。

玩火。 你使一团火焰闪烁，变亮，变暗或变色，其效应持续 1 分钟。

无形之手。 你使一扇没有锁上的门或窗立即打开或关上。

幻音。 你使一阵瞬时声音自施法距离内一点发出，例如雷鸣声，渡鸦叫声或不祥低语声。

震动。 你在地面上引发无害的震动，其效应持续 1 分钟。

Command.name: 命令术
Command.description:
你对施法距离内一个你能看见的生物说出一个单词的命令。目标生物必须通过一次感知豁免，否则在它自己的下一回合中，其必须服从这道命令行事。从以下选项中选择一条命令：

过来。 目标以最短最直接的路线向你移动，若其到达你 5 尺范围内，其会结束自己的回合。

放下。 目标放下持握的任何东西，然后结束自己的回合。

走开。 目标消耗其整个回合，以最快最有效的方式远离你。

趴下。 目标陷入倒地状态并结束自己的回合。

立定。 在其回合内，目标不进行移动且不作任何动作和附赠动作。

升环施法： 你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术就能多影响一个目标。

Hold Person.name: 定身类人
Hold Person.description:
指定施法距离内一个你能看见的类人生物。该目标必须进行一次感知豁免，豁免失败则其在法术持续时间内陷入 &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] 状态。目标在其每回合结束时可以重新进行这次豁免，豁免成功则终止其身上该法术的效应。

升环施法： 使用三环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比二环高一环，就可以额外指定一个生物作为目标。

Paralyzed.name: 麻痹
Paralyzed.description: 你在每回合结束时可以重新进行[[/save ability=wis]]豁免，豁免成功则终止你身上该法术的效应。

Manes Vaporspawn.name: 原魔汽化体
Manes Vaporspawn.description:
原魔

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.veNtTec5Xx4Cu1Y9 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

原魔汽化体

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.rnHk70BN9bhrV1CG caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Contortionist.name: 擅曲之物
Contortionist.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 可以移动穿过最窄 1 寸宽的空间而无需消耗额外的移动力。

Sickening Vapors.name: 致病蒸汽
Sickening Vapors.description:
体质豁免检定：DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=a9NAwfq8B1qvfEi7]]，[[lookup @name lowcase]] 回合结束时位于源自 [[lookup @name lowcase] 的 [[lookup @target.template.size activity=a9NAwfq8B1qvfEi7]] 尺光环内的所有生物。

失败：目标陷入 &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] 状态直至其下一回合结束

成功：目标在 24 小时内免疫此 [[lookup @name lowcase]] 的致病蒸汽。

Incapacitated.name: 失能
Incapacitated.description: 你陷入 &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] 状态直至下一回合结束。

Shadow Stealth.name: 幽影隐匿
Shadow Stealth.description: 若 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 身处微光光照或黑暗，其执行 &Reference[Hide] 动作。

Introduction.name: Introduction
Introduction.text:
An Adventure for

Level 1 Characters

The Lost Library of Lethchauntos is an adventure that you can use in any of the five settings described in chapters 2–6 of this book: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTheDalelands0.JournalEntryPage.ZhQaD0Buy6MeuFHK]{the Dalelands}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifIcewindDale00]{Icewind Dale}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifCalimshan0000]{Calimshan}, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifMoonshaeIsles]{Moonshae Isles}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifBaldursGate00]{Baldur’s Gate}.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifArtHandouts00.JournalEntryPage.pejNI4JyEWyfz8x3]

Adventure Summary.name: Adventure Summary
Adventure Summary.text:
The characters are contacted by Myrna Nor, a student of magic and wealthy heir. Myrna and her former colleague, Powell “the Owl” Niccam, have deduced the location of a hidden library built centuries ago by Lethchauntos, an infamous wizard.

But Myrna and Powell have had a falling out. The library is believed to contain the Nathlum, a legendary book detailing deadly poisons and powerful spells. Powell wants to recover the Nathlum and sell it to the Zhentarim for a fortune. Myrna wants to preserve the Nathlum and restore Lethchauntos’s unjustly tarnished legacy.

Myrna hires the characters to find the Nathlum before Powell does. The party travels to the library to find Powell already there. They must overcome her guards and navigate the library’s dangers. Eventually the characters confront Powell to recover the Nathlum.

The adventure takes two or three sessions. When the characters return to Myrna, hopefully with the Nathlum, they should be level 3.

Running the Adventure.name: Running the Adventure
Running the Adventure.text:
To run this adventure, you need the fifth edition core rulebooks (Player’s Handbook, Dungeon Master’s Guide, and Monster Manual).

Text that appears in a box like this is meant to be read aloud or paraphrased for the players when their characters first arrive at a location or under specific circumstances described in the text.

The Monster Manual contains stat blocks for most of the creatures encountered in this adventure. The remaining stat blocks can be found in chapter 9 of this book, as indicated in the text.

Spells and equipment mentioned in the adventure are described in the Player’s Handbook. Magic items are described in the Dungeon Master’s Guide.

Choosing a Setting.name: Choosing a Setting
Choosing a Setting.text: The library described in this chapter is located in the Dalelands. But you can use this adventure if your campaign is set in one of the other settings described in this book, moving the library described here to your campaign’s location. See the “@UUID[.Ps54vCbjGHUcdQt2]{Customizing the Adventure}” section later in this chapter for guidance on adapting the adventure to Icewind Dale, Calimshan, the Moonshae Isles, or Baldur’s Gate.

Starting the Adventure.name: Starting the Adventure
Starting the Adventure.text:
When you’re ready to start the adventure, read or paraphrase the following:

You meet at the Old Skull Inn in Shadowdale. Your host is Myrna Nor, the heir to a wealthy Sembian trading house. When you arrive, she gestures toward chairs in a rustic sitting room. “Please, make yourselves comfortable. I’m so grateful to you all for meeting me here. I have a terrible problem, and I’m hoping you can solve it.

“My colleague Powell Niccam and I learned of a hidden library built by a long-dead orc wizard named Lethchauntos. He wrote the Nathlum, a book of arcane lore that we believe is located in this hidden library. But Powell has offered to sell the tome’s secrets to the Zhentarim!

“The Nathlum details how to create many rare poisons, as well as their cures. Who knows what the Zhentarim would do with such knowledge? No, the Nathlum—and the rest of the library—must be recovered for the good of Faerûn.”

Myrna offers the characters [[/award each 100gp]] each to travel to the library and recover the Nathlum. She can answer questions about Lethchauntos, Powell, and the Nathlum. She can tell the characters the information in “Lethchauntos’s Tragic Life” above, which she has pieced together though she’s eager to obtain more evidence. She insists Lethchauntos wasn’t an evil wizard but a tragic and well-meaning figure, if sometimes misguided.

Myrna describes Powell as a cunning and brilliant student of magic. Powell is tall and thin, with a wide-eyed, blinking expression that earned her the nickname “the Owl.”

As for the Nathlum, Myrna knows the tome contains poison recipes and powerful spells, but she doesn’t know the exact details.

Myrna provides the location of the library’s entrance in Cormanthor, beneath a hill between the Standing Stone and Myth Drannor. She tells the characters Lethchauntos built five hidden libraries, reburying one of his family members at each, but she believes the Nathlum is at this one.

Adventure Background.name: Adventure Background
Adventure Background.text:
The story of this adventure involves an infamous wizard named Lethchauntos whose work and legacy have been long misunderstood. Recently two students of magic discovered the truth about him and located five hidden libraries he constructed.

Lethchauntos’s Tragic Life

Five centuries ago, an orc priest named Wund forged a kingdom under the Sword Mountains, choosing an orc warlord named Uruth as a figurehead ruler. Wund was devoted to an evil god of death and disease, and Uruth was a cruel warmonger. A young orc wizard named Nath fled the Sword Mountains with his wife Ona and their children to avoid the wars he knew Wund and Uruth would soon wage.

Settling near the village of Phandalin south of Neverwinter, Nath traded with farming families and shared arcane knowledge with the crafters of nearby Wave Echo Cave. Nath hid his identity to protect himself and his family, and the folk of Phandalin knew him as Lethchauntos.

Nath and his family had peace for a few years but, deeply troubled by Wund’s leadership, Lethchauntos decided to take action. With the skilled crafters of Wave Echo Cave, he forged the Ettin Axe, a sentient weapon with two distinct minds and personalities. Then, leaving his family, he returned to the Sword Mountains and sought out Uruth. Nath argued that Wund was selfish and manipulative, and Uruth had an obligation to be a wiser, better king. He gave Uruth the Ettin Axe, optimistically hoping that the axe’s two minds would balance out the bad advice Uruth was getting from Wend.

For a brief time, Wund, Nath, Uruth, and the twin minds of the Ettin Axe were locked in a power struggle for Uruth’s realm. But communications from Nath’s family ceased and, fearing the worst, the wizard fled home to find his family dead from poisons only Wund knew how to brew. Wund’s spies had identified Nath’s family and murdered them.

Nath was devastated. Donning black robes of mourning, he forsook his birth name. For the rest of his life, he wore only black and answered only to Lethchauntos. For twenty years, he researched Wund’s poisons in an attempt to find antidotes to the poisons that killed his family, collecting this knowledge in a book he dubbed the Nathlum, and planned elaborate memorials for his loved ones.

Uruth and Wund eventually perished in war, but one of Uruth’s successors discovered Lethchauntos’s location and led a raid against Phandalin, devastating the region.

Lethchauntos survived, but he considered himself cursed for bringing death to his friends and family. He left Phandalin and put his final plans in motion, visiting the Dalelands, Icewind Dale, Calimshan, the Moonshae Isles, and Baldur’s Gate, places his family had spoken of visiting. In each of these locations, he constructed a hidden library, burying one of his family in each location. When the last library was complete, Lethchauntos departed for the Outer Planes. His final fate is unknown.

A Tale of Two Apprentices

Today Lethchauntos is mostly forgotten, and those who do recall him believe he was an evil wizard due to his association with poison and slaughter. But two students of magic named Myrna Nor and Powell Niccam discovered the existence of the Nathlum from old records found in Phandalin and Wave Echo Cave. The two didn’t agree on what to do next, though. While Myrna wanted to recover the Nathlum for academic purposes, Powell saw an opportunity to get rich quick.

Powell reached out to Zhentarim agents and told them about the Nathlum, which details many deadly poisons. She offered to share the knowledge with the Zhentarim in exchange for the agents’ help in recovering the Nathlum. With Zhentarim allies and goblin and hobgoblin mercenaries she hired along the way, Powell set out for the hidden library near Myth Drannor.

Myrna wants to stop Powell, but she’s no adventurer. She uses her merchant contacts to locate the characters, and she hires them to stop Powell and recover the Nathlum.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifArtHandouts00.JournalEntryPage.wyqB4W80WDv0k1xb inline]

Aftermath.name: Aftermath
Aftermath.text:
If the party returns the Nathlum to Myrna, she is overjoyed by their success and rewards each character with the promised [[/award 100gp]], asking them to relate everything they’ve discovered. She is especially glad if they have Lethchauntos’s journal, which supports Myrna’s theories about the wizard’s life. For completing their quest, each character gains [[/award 100xp]]. The characters should now be level 3.

If the party was successful, Myrna points out that Lethchauntos built four more libraries in different parts of Faerûn. Each awaits discovery, and who knows what mysteries they contain? You can design these libraries yourself, using the library described in this chapter as inspiration.

Alternatively, chapters 1 through 6 of this book include adventures, including several designed for level 3 characters that would be apt continuations from this adventure.

The Nathlum.name: The Nathlum
The Nathlum.text:
The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifNathlum000000]{Nathlum} is a nondescript book with a gray canvas cover and parchment pages. It was written by Lethchauntos in Common. It contains two spells and the recipes for many poisons.

The Nathlum contains the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGlyphofWar]{Glyph of Warding} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMaze000000]{Maze} spells. The book can’t be used to cast these spells, but a Wizard can copy these spells into their spellbook as described in the Player’s Handbook.

The Nathlum also contains the recipes for every poison in the Dungeon Master’s Guide, plus four additional poisons described below. A character with the Nathlum can use a Poisoner’s Kit to craft any poison described in the book, using the rules for crafting equipment in the Player’s Handbook. The Nathlum also contains instructions for crafting Elixirs of Health (see rules for crafting magic items in the Dungeon Master’s Guide).

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifDeathdance000]{Deathdance} (200 GP)

Injury Poison

A creature subjected to Deathdance must succeed on a [[/save 13 constitution]] or have the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. Humanoids automatically succeed on this save. The creature also has the Incapacitated condition while Poisoned in this way, as it thrashes uncontrollably.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifPrespra000000]{Prespra} (300 GP)

Ingested Poison

A creature subjected to Prespra must succeed on a [[/save 11 constitution]] or take 3 (1d6) Poison damage and have the Poisoned condition. The creature also has the Blinded condition while Poisoned in this way. The creature repeats the save at the start of each of its turns, taking 3 (1d6) Poison damage on a failed save. On a successful save, the effect ends for the creature.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifUlcrun0000000]{Ulcrun} (1,000 GP)

Injury Poison

A creature subjected to Ulcrun must succeed on a [[/save 15 constitution]] or take 21 (6d6) Poison damage and gain 1 Exhaustion level.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifYellowDeath00]{Yellow Death} (150 GP)

Ingested Poison

A creature subjected to Yellow Death makes a [[/save 13 constitution]]. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) Poison damage and has the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

Customizing the Adventure.name: Customizing the Adventure
Customizing the Adventure.text: Lethchauntos built five libraries, one in each of these locations: the Dalelands, Icewind Dale, Calimshan, the Moonshae Isles, and Baldur’s Gate. The library described in this chapter appears in the Dalelands, but you can customize the adventure to fit one of the other settings as described below.

Library Features.name: Library Features
Library Features.text:
The library has the following features.

Light

Powell and her followers placed lit torches in wall sconces throughout the library. Unless otherwise described, the library is in Bright Light.

Doors

The library contains various secret and locked doors. See the rules for doors in the Dungeon Master’s Guide. All secret doors are standard ([[/tool 15 ability=dexterity tool=thief]]{DC 15}). All locked doors have Simple locks (1 action to pick) of Good quality ([[/tool 15 ability=dexterity tool=thief]]{DC 15}).

Goblin Knowledge

A character who interrogates a goblin or hobgoblin and succeeds on a [[/skill 15 intimidation or persuasion]] check learns the following.

Powell. The goblins and hobgoblins work for Powell, whom they call “Owl-Face” and consider “a mighty wizard.” Powell arrived at the library a day ago and has been exploring it. Powell posted the goblins and hobgoblins on the upper level and instructed them to kill intruders.

Powell’s Lackeys. Powell has Zhentarim guards who followed her to the lower level, and a few goblins accompanied her as well.

Upper-Floor Layout. The goblin and hobgoblin mercenaries know the layout of the library’s upper floor. They avoid the bear in @UUID[.uPjos95geyDwaX4X]{area 3} and the trapped statue in @UUID[.BI9Az7GTotdCw1tB]{area 6}.

Upper Level.name: Upper Level
Upper Level.text:
The following locations are keyed to @UUID[Scene.aifLostLibraryUp]{map 7.1}.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.Xe9qk9lxqIUaARY1 caption=false]

Traveling to the Library.name: Traveling to the Library
Traveling to the Library.text:
The journey to the library is about 100 miles, a journey of 4 days. You can roll random encounters on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncCormanthor]{Cormanthor Encounters }table in chapter 2 or have the journey be uneventful. Along the way, the characters can get to know each other, sharing elements of their backstories as they travel.

When the characters reach the library entrance, read or paraphrase the following:

The door to the lost library of Lethchauntos stands before you, right where Myrna Nor said it would be. The door is built into a hillside, but you clearly aren’t the first ones to discover it. Brush has been cleared away from it, and footprints lead up to the closed door.

As a Search action, a character can inspect the prints and make a [[/skill 10 survival]] check, identifying them on a successful check as belonging to Medium and Small booted people, some of them goblinoids. The door opens to reveal a corridor leading north to @UUID[.24E3UOT3f7K4NPEw]{area 1}.

A character who searches the nearby area finds a cave 150 feet from the library door. A character who takes the Study action and succeeds on a [[/skill 10 nature]] check determines the cave leads to a bear’s den. This cave entrance leads to @UUID[.uPjos95geyDwaX4X]{area 3}.

Lower Level.name: Lower Level
Lower Level.text:
The following locations are keyed to @UUID[Scene.aifLostLibraryLo]{map 7.2}.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.ZTaSf8M1tuWSfZ8H caption=false]

Icewind Dale.name: 冰风谷
Icewind Dale.text:
The Icewind Dale version of the adventure delves into the survival horror genre. Myrna calls the characters together in Bryn Shander. The library is dug into Kelvin’s Cairn. Powell found the library, cleared the door of ice and snow, and led a team inside, but encountered the undead corpses of previous explorers. Most of her followers are dead, but the undead remain active and hungry.

Library Features

The library has no light sources and is in Darkness throughout. Descriptions assume the characters have a light source or other means of seeing in Darkness.

Corpses and Treasure

Place ten fresh corpses anywhere in the library—these are followers of Powell who were killed by undead. Each corpse has [[/award 2d6*10gp]].

Encounter Areas

Modify areas of the library in the following ways.

1: Guard Station. Replace the goblins and worg with six @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifZombie0000000]{Zombies}. If the zombies detect the characters, they begin combat.

3: Cavern. The bear is a polar bear, but a fungal infection carried by fish from the Underdark has weakened it (use the Brown Bear stat block).

5: Supply Room. Replace the hobgoblins with three @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifTough00000000]{Toughs}, followers of Powell who have barricaded themselves in this room. They want to get out of the library alive but are afraid to leave and are Hostile. They warn the party and begin combat if the characters don’t retreat.

6: Display Room. Replace Regret with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifSpecter000000]{Specter} imprisoned in the glass sphere by Lethchauntos long ago. It communicates with anyone who touches the sphere, promising its aid, but it is lying. If the sphere is broken, the specter flees.

8: Rotunda. Replace the goblins with two @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifGhoul00000000]{Ghouls} that hide on the ground floor of this room. The floor is littered with the corpses of Powell’s followers, some of whom have been meals for the ghouls. The ghouls attempt to ambush the party.

12: Sitting Room. Replace the soldiers with three @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifGhoul00000000]{Ghouls} who lair here. The ghouls roam singly through areas 9–15 but don’t know about the vault (area 11). If one of them spots the party, it retreats to gather its fellows and plan an ambush.

13: Powell’s Bedroom. The ghouls know the Mimic is hiding here, but they ignore it. Move the treasure in this room to Powell, in area 16.

14: Empty Bedroom. This room is no longer safe for characters to rest in; the ghouls in area 12 consider it part of their territory.

16: Gallery. Replace the three goblins with a human lackey (Medium @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifTough00000000]{Tough}). This follower and the Zhentarim bodyguard also in this room are all that remains of Powell’s allies. Powell tries to negotiate with the party, suggesting the two groups work together to escape the library, sell the Nathlum to the Zhentarim, and split the money. If the party refuses, she initiates combat. If the party accepts her offer, she and her followers betray the party as soon as they leave the library.

Baldur’s Gate.name: 博德之门
Baldur’s Gate.text:
Adventures in Baldur’s Gate often involve temptation by devils and questionable alliances with morally ambiguous individuals. The influence of the Dead Three is never far away.

In this version of the adventure, Myrna brings the characters together at the Helm and Cloak. The library is located in the sewers beneath the city. Powell intends to sell the Nathlum to patriars who belong to devil-worshiping cults, but some of her followers secretly answer to the Dead Three instead, and others have been killed by monsters living in the sewers.

Encounter Areas

Modify areas of the library in the following ways.

1: Guard Station. Powell left guards here, but most of them have been killed by six @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifTroglodyte000]{Troglodytes} that are still here, eating the dead. If disturbed, they begin combat. One of Powell’s followers, a human named Bors (Medium @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifCultist000000]{Cultist}), cowers in the locked cage. If freed, he admits to being one of Powell’s followers but asks only to be allowed to escape.

3: Cavern. Replace the bear with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifGhoul00000000]{Ghoul} named Slymon. Slymon is Indifferent to the party, and will let them pass if they agree to bring him a Humanoid corpse he can eat. If the party refuses, he initiates combat.

5: Supply Room. Replace the hobgoblins with six of Powell’s human followers (Medium @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifCultist000000]{Cultists}) searching the crates for supplies. They fight the characters. If outnumbered by the party, the survivors try to flee to area 8.

6: Display Room. Replace Regret with an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifImp0000000000]{Imp} named Bitterbite, imprisoned in the glass sphere by Lethchauntos long ago. Bitterbite pleads to be released. If freed, the devil helps the characters as a way to help itself, ingratiating itself to the party at every opportunity. If ever in serious danger, Bitterbite flees.

8: Rotunda. Replace the goblins with six of Powell’s human followers (Medium @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifCultist000000]{Cultists}) and their human leader (Medium @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifSpy0000000000]{Spy}). They’re searching the books for anything of value and are loyal to Powell. They fight the characters.

12: Sitting Room. Replace the Zhentilar Soldiers with human pirates (Medium @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifPirate0000000]{Pirates}). They came here with Powell but have grown bored and pass time with games of chance. The pirates aren’t loyal to Powell and can be bribed to leave peacefully with an offer of at least 10 GP total. If two of them are killed in battle, the third surrenders and begs for mercy.

13: Powell’s Bedroom. Remove the mimic from this room; see area 15 below for a replacement monster.

15: Privy. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifCarrionCrawle]{Carrion Crawler} squeezed its way up the privy, destroying the wooden board covering the hole in the process. It was discovered by a pirate from area 12 and killed him. It is still here, clinging to the ceiling and slowly devouring the corpse. It fights intruders.

16: Gallery. The party arrives just in time to see Powell betrayed by Aglanna (Medium, Neutral Evil @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatic}), who is pretending to be her bodyguard but really serving one of the Dead Three. Aglanna stabs Powell in the back, killing her, and seizes the Nathlum. She is served by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifManesVaporspa]{Manes Vaporspawn} and six human followers (Medium, Neutral Evil @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifCultist000000]{Cultists}). Aglanna offers the characters twice what Myrna is paying them ([[/award each 200gp]]) to let her leave with the Nathlum. If the party agrees, she is true to her word. If they refuse, she and her allies begin combat.

Moonshae Isles.name: Moonshae Isles
Moonshae Isles.text:
Adventures in the Moonshae Isles often involve Fey creatures and the Rusting. Clever adventurers often use diplomacy to avoid violence.

In this version of the adventure, Myrna brings the characters together at Caer Calidyrr. The entrance to the library is near the moonwell in the northwest corner of the Dernall Forest. The library itself, however, is in the Feywild. Anyone who passes through the door finds themself in the library south of area 1. Powell found the door and led her followers through, where she found bullywugs and other fey living in the library.

Bullywugs

Replace all the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifGoblinWarrior]{Goblin Warriors} in the adventure with @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifBullywugWarri]{Bullywug Warriors}. These bullywugs revere Lethchauntos as a mighty mage and consider the Nathlum a sacred object, but they don’t know much about Lethchauntos, and they’ve never dared touch the book.

Powell has convinced the bullywugs that intruders are coming to steal the Nathlum and that she’s here to help the bullywugs defend it.

Encounter Areas

Modify areas of the library in the following ways.

1: Guard Station. The bullywugs are awake and alert. Replace the Worg with two @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifGiantFrog0000]{Giant Frogs} that obey the bullywugs. The bullywugs immediately fight the characters.

3: Cavern. The bear has signs of the Rusting. This doesn’t affect its stat block. The curse was carried by the stream, which is tinted with rust from the Moonshae Isles and has a metallic smell. There’s little the characters can do for the bear, but a character who tries to help it has Advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks to calm it. The tunnel south leads to the Feywild.

5: Supply Room. Replace the hobgoblins with three @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifSatyr00000000]{Satyrs} recuperating here after a night of revelry. Powell charged the satyrs with driving the characters out of the library, but the satyrs are Indifferent to the party and don’t much feel like fighting. If spoken to, they tell the party about Powell and the poison gas trap in area 6, which they don’t know how to deactivate. They won’t join the characters, insisting they have terrible headaches.

6: Display Room. Replace Regret with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifFaerieDragonY]{Faerie Dragon Youth} named Precocia, imprisoned in the glass sphere by Lethchauntos long ago. Precocia can communicate with anyone who touches the glass sphere. If freed, it accompanies and helps the party.

8: Rotunda. This room is surrounded by large magical windows that reveal the Feywild outside the library. Replace the Goblin Boss with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifGiantToad0000]{Giant Toad} that obeys the bullywugs, who lie in wait for the party. As soon as they see the characters, the bullywugs ambush them.

12: Sitting Room. Characters eavesdropping on the soldiers hear them boast about how Powell has tricked the bullywugs into serving her by claiming to protect the Nathlum, when she intends to steal it. The soldiers are cowards; if the party surprises them, they surrender.

13: Powell’s Bedroom. Replace the Mimic with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifBulettePup000]{Bulette Pup}, which burrowed into the privy (area 15) and killed Erik before retreating to this room and hiding under the bed. The bulette isn’t aggressive and flees if the characters try to fight it.

16: Gallery. Powell is here with her bodyguard and three Hostile @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifBullywugWarri]{Bullywug Warriors}. Powell confidently orders her bullywug minions and bodyguard to fight. As an Influence action, a character can try to convince the bullywugs that Powell is lying to them and make a [[/skill 13 persuasion]] check. On a successful check, the bullywugs turn their weapons on Powell. If this happens, or if her Zhentarim bodyguard is killed, Powell surrenders.

19: Chasm. The tunnel leading south from this area leads to the Feywild instead of the Underdark.

Calimshan.name: Calimshan
Calimshan.text:
Adventures in Calimshan juxtapose desert isolation and the elemental magic of genies with the sophistication of Calimport and the Mechanical Wonders found there.

In this version of the adventure, Myrna calls the characters together in Calimport. Lethchauntos’s library is in the Calim Desert. Powell has brought several mechanical soldiers to complement her Zhentarim allies but discovered elementals living in the library who were quick to defend it.

Mechanical Soldiers

Replace all the Goblin Warriors in the adventure with mechanical soldiers (@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifModronDuodron]{Modron Duodrones}). The mechanical warriors obey Powell without question and never retreat. A character searching a fallen soldier gathers [[/award 2d6gp]].

Encounter Areas

Modify areas of the library in the following ways.

1: Guard Station. Replace the Worg with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifDustMephit000]{Dust Mephit} that has locked itself in the cage and is taunting the mechanical soldiers, which can’t reach it through the bars. The soldiers are distracted, but when they notice the characters, they begin combat. Once combat is underway, the mephit squeezes out between the bars of the cage and joins in the violence, fighting indiscriminately.

3: Cavern. Replace the bear with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.mmLion0000000000]{Lion}. It behaves as described for the bear.

5: Supply Room. Replace the hobgoblins with three @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifDustMephit000]{Dust Mephits} that live in the library. They’ve defeated some mechanical soldiers and assume the characters are with Powell. Unless convinced otherwise, the mephits order the party to leave, initiating combat if the characters don’t comply.

6: Display Room. Replace Regret with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifSphinxOfWonde]{Sphinx of Wonder} named Scirocco, imprisoned in the glass sphere by Lethchauntos long ago. Scirocco pleads with the characters to be released and assists them if freed, under the same restrictions Regret would have. Scirocco is obsessed with the Calim Desert and might accompany the party longer if they agree to help it learn about the desert.

8: Rotunda. Replace the Goblin Boss with @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifAnimatedArmor]{Animated Armor}. It and the mechanical soldiers stand motionless on the lower level, but when they notice the party, they initiate combat.

13: Powell’s Bedroom. Replace the Mimic with an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifAnimatedRugOf]{Animated Rug of Smothering} that obeys Powell’s commands. The carpet murdered Erik when he snuck into this room and tried to steal Powell’s treasure. If the characters try to do the same, it ambushes them.

18: Forge. An @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.aifAzerSentinel0]{Azer Sentinel} named Falchia lives and works in this room, which is in Bright Light from the active forge. Falchia assisted Lethchauntos in crafting Lethchauntos’s Legacy but now considers the forge to be hers. Falchia speaks to the party if any of them know Primordial (Ignan), telling them of the weapon’s making. She wants to see Lethchauntos’s Legacy used by heroic individuals and offers the party the weapon. If unable to communicate with the characters, Falchia gestures to the greataxe and allows the characters to take it, then resumes working the forge.

19: Chasm. The tunnel leading south away from this room gets hotter and hotter, eventually ending in a portal to the Elemental Plane of Fire.

Guard Station.name: Guard Station
Guard Station.text:
A door stands ajar in the north wall of this room, and a hole has been dug in the east wall. A goblin stands on watch, while other goblins talk and rest nearby. An open cage fills the southwest corner of the room, and a large wolflike creature lies curled up in the cage.

The four @UUID[Actor.aifGoblinWarrior]{Goblin Warriors} posted in this room were told to not allow anyone inside the library. One watches the entrance and the tunnel to @UUID[.uPjos95geyDwaX4X]{area 3}. One is asleep in a corner. The other two sit together, eating and telling stories. A @UUID[Actor.aifWorg000000000], allied to the goblins, lies curled up half-asleep in the cage. The cage’s door is unlocked and open.

When the goblins spot intruders, they stand and draw their weapons. Read or paraphrase the following:

“This ain’t no place for visitors,” one goblin says, “so turn right around, march yourself out of here, and don’t come back.” As the goblin talks, the wolflike creature rises in the cage, stretching and yawning.

If the party doesn’t retreat, the goblins and worg begin combat.

If the gate to the cage shuts, it locks. The cage is centuries old, and none of the goblins have the key. As a Utilize action, a character can try to pick the lock using Thieves’ Tools, doing so with a successful [[/skill 10 slt]] check. Bending open the old iron bars of the cage requires a creature to make a successful [[/skill 20 athletics]] check as an action. The cage’s bars are wide enough that Small creatures can slip between them.

Treasure. Each goblin has [[/award 1d6*4gp]] in its pockets.

Barrack.name: Barrack
Barrack.text:
This old barrack contains four humble beds. At the foot of each bed is an old, shabby storage locker. A corridor north is blocked by an iron portcullis. On the far side of the bars, near a closed door, a winch is mounted on the wall.

The library’s guards once lived here, but now this room is abandoned.

Portcullis. The portcullis to the north is a Medium iron portcullis (see chapter 3 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide). The winch can’t be reached or operated from the south side of the bars. Characters might solve this problem with spells like @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplUnseenServ]{Unseen Servant}. Once the portcullis is lifted, a lever can be flipped on the winch, locking the bars in place.

The door north leads to @UUID[.9W7Nk11jdRz1f9Gi]{area 8}. It is closed but unlocked.

Cavern.name: Cavern
Cavern.text:
This chamber is in Darkness. The description below assumes the characters have a light source or other means of seeing in Darkness:

A winding tunnel ends in a large natural cavern. A stream breaks through the western wall and cuts a curving arc through the cavern, exiting through a hole in the south wall. A hole in the north wall reveals a smaller adjacent cave, and a tunnel winds away to the northeast. A large brown bear rises from the stream. A fish drops from the bear’s mouth to the water as it roars!

Centuries ago, creatures from the Underdark followed the stream’s path into this cavern and dug tunnels connecting to @UUID[.24E3UOT3f7K4NPEw]{areas 1} and @UUID[.fvY9hvoMcPUiiIGN]{5}. The stream’s tunnel is no longer navigable.

This cavern is now claimed by a @UUID[Actor.aifBrownBear0000]{Brown Bear}. The bear is Hostile to intruders but doesn’t immediately fight them, instead attempting to deter the party with its roar. As an Influence action, a character can try calming the bear and make a [[/skill 13 ani]] check, changing its attitude to Indifferent on a successful check. If the characters can’t calm the bear and don’t retreat, the bear begins combat. It doesn’t enter @UUID[.JbKZzY3kZCB2v3g9]{areas 2} or @UUID[.fvY9hvoMcPUiiIGN]{5}, avoiding the goblins and hobgoblins there.

If the bear is calmed, it retreats to @UUID[.TjBRbjAMgkmWVBvC]{area 4} and allows the party to move through @UUID[.uPjos95geyDwaX4X]{area 3}.

Treasure. Characters searching the cavern find skeletal remains in the shallow stream. Among these remains is a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifClockworkAmul]{Clockwork Amulet}.

Den.name: Den
Den.text:
This chamber reeks of animal scent and is where the bear in @UUID[.uPjos95geyDwaX4X]{area 3} sleeps.

If the party succeeds in calming or negotiating with the bear, the bear retreats here and guards its den against intruders. It growls to warn characters who try to enter the den and initiates combat if the characters do so anyway.

Supply Room.name: Supply Room
Supply Room.text:
This square chamber is filled with crates and stacks of supplies, including flat wooden slats, simple leather, and parchment. A hallway leads north out of the chamber. Three armed hobgoblins methodically search the crates.

This room contains decrepit supplies for bookbinding, copying, and other library tasks. A space along the western wall, where a secret door is located, has been cleared of crates.

Three @UUID[Actor.aifHobgoblinWarr]{Hobgoblin Warriors} search the crates. Originally posted in @UUID[.BI9Az7GTotdCw1tB]{area 6}, they ran afoul of the trap there and wandered here hoping to find something valuable. The hobgoblins are distracted, and if the characters succeed on [[/skill 10 stealth]] checks, they can surprise the hobgoblins. When the hobgoblins spot the characters, they begin combat.

Development. If two of the hobgoblins are defeated, the third attempts to flee through the secret door to @UUID[.9W7Nk11jdRz1f9Gi]{area 8} and alert the goblins there.

Treasure. Each hobgoblin has [[/award 1d8*3gp]] in its pockets. One crate contains nine bottles of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagInk00000000]{Ink}, and a small wooden box contains six sticks of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifIncense000000]{incense} worth 10 GP each.

Display Room.name: Display Room
Display Room.text:
Display shelves line this large room, and a central table is crowded with knickknacks large and small, including a glass sphere glowing with silver light. A large, intimidating iron statue of a wolf stands in the southeast corner, and a corridor exits from the northwest. Words are written above both entrances to the room.

This room is filled with mementos of Lethchauntos’s life and family. The wolf statue is a dangerous trap, and the glass sphere imprisons a creature; see below for more on both. The words written above the entrances are in the Orc language and read, “The wolf does not bite the hand that feeds it.” This is a clue to avoiding or disarming the trap.

Trap. The wolf statue is a magical trap. If a creature touches the table or anything on it—including the glass sphere—without first disarming the trap, the statue fills the room with toxic gas. Each creature in the room when the trap activates makes a [[/save 11 constitution format=long]], taking [[/damage 2d4 poison average]] damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The trap resets after 1 minute.

Disarming the Trap. A tiny switch is hidden in the mouth of the statue. Anyone who inspects the mouth of the statue or reaches into the mouth finds the switch and can flip it, disabling the trap.

Glass Sphere. The glass sphere is an enchanted prison for Regret­—a Celestial, Neutral Good @UUID[Actor.aifEmpyreanIota0]{Empyrean Iota} embodying a faded memory of Mystra, a deity of magic. Lethchauntos imprisoned the iota in the sphere long ago and accidentally abandoned it when he left. The sphere has 1 Hit Point and breaks if dropped or thrown at the ground. If the sphere breaks, Regret is freed.

If a character approaches the sphere, it pulses faintly with silver light. A character touching the sphere makes contact with Regret’s mind and hears the words, “Set me free, I beg you!” in their mind.

Regret can communicate mentally with anyone touching the sphere. It pleads with the characters to break the sphere and free it, promising to use its powers on their behalf, but it refuses to carry out evil actions. If Regret is freed, it makes good on its promise, assisting the characters with any encounters on this level of the library, including @UUID[.9W7Nk11jdRz1f9Gi]{area 8}. Regret won’t go further into the library, and after assisting the characters for up to 1 day, it flees the library.

Treasure. Most of the items displayed here are personal items of no significant value. There are three objects of note, however, on the table: a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifDiamond000000]{diamond} worth 50 GP, a vial of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolyWater00]{Holy Water}, and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifGildedAcorn00]{gilded acorn} worth 200 GP. The acorn contains a feather, a tuft of fur, and a fish scale. This acorn can be used with the summoning circle in @UUID[.XfpPQxL4c04tL4MD]{area 9}.

Experience Points. If the party frees Regret, award each character a bonus [[/award 75xp]].

Guest Quarters.name: Guest Quarters
Guest Quarters.text:
The door opens to reveal a bed chamber containing musty furniture. A second door stands on the far wall.

Powell and her goblin minions know about this room but have no reason to come here, entering the rotunda (@UUID[.9W7Nk11jdRz1f9Gi]{area 8}) through @UUID[.JbKZzY3kZCB2v3g9]{area 2} or @UUID[.fvY9hvoMcPUiiIGN]{5}. This room is therefore safer than other parts of the library. If the party shuts the door and doesn’t attract attention, they can rest here without being disturbed.

Rotunda.name: Rotunda
Rotunda.text:
This magnificent, circular library is filled with thousands of books, including one displayed in a glass case. A balcony even with the upper level circles the gallery, eventually descending to the library floor by way of a handsome staircase. Several goblins pull books off the shelves, throwing them onto a large pile in the middle of the room, where a well-armed goblin holding a tinderbox stands. “Hurry up,” this goblin says. “I’m getting cold, and nothing drives off the chill like a nice, big bonfire.”

The goblin lighting the fire is Glaxby, a @UUID[Actor.aifGoblinBoss000]{Goblin Boss}. Four @UUID[Actor.aifGoblinWarrior]{Goblin Warriors} in the room do as Glaxby commands. The goblins don’t notice characters on the upper level of the rotunda.

Once he sees the party, Glaxby orders the other goblins into battle. If Glaxby or three of the goblins warriors are defeated, the survivors flee the library.

Books. If a character searches the shelves, you can roll on the table below to generate a title.

Foundry Note

Scene Regions: The Teleport Token region on the Upper Level map is disabled to allow your party to maintain the high ground, preventing accidental teleportation to the Lower Level map (feel free to enable it at your convenience).. However, the Teleport Token region on the Lower Level map is enabled to allow movement back to the Upper Level.

NPCs. Two groups of NPCs are pre-placed on the map: one group on the hidden Upper Level Map, while the other group is visible, giving you flexibility in how your party engages the goblins.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifTblRotundaBoo rollable caption=false resultLabel="Rotunda Books"]

Treasure. Each goblin warrior has [[/award 1d6*4gp]] in its pockets. Glaxby has [[/award 8gp]]. The book in the glass case is an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifEnduringSpell]{Enduring Spellbook}. Its pages are empty.

Development. Three doors exit the rotunda’s lower floor, providing access to the library’s lower level. The north door, leading to @UUID[.XfpPQxL4c04tL4MD]{area 9}, is open. The south door, to @UUID[.kAyCOnVOjAWJB4nV]{area 16}, is closed but unlocked. The east door, leading to @UUID[.fB3IfDXo3BP8LZ2t]{area 19}, is locked. The key is in Lethchauntos’s chambers (@UUID[.L3GJCVc6JRD6jLZh]{area 17}).

The characters should be level 2 before venturing further into the lower level.

Summoning Chamber.name: Summoning Chamber
Summoning Chamber.text:
A silver circle inscribed on the floor and decorated with magical runes fills this chamber. Voices can be heard through a door on the west wall. A thick, heavy curtain hangs in the room’s northeast corner.

The curtain depicts a rough map of the Dalelands, but it is centuries old and thus inaccurate.

Summoning Circle. The circle on the floor is magical. As a Study action, a character can inspect it and make a [[/skill 15 arcana]] check, discerning how to use it on a successful check.

Using the Circle. A character with proficiency in the Arcana skill can take a Magic action to touch the circle and cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSummonBeas]{Summon Beast} spell. The creature must provide the spell’s Material component, which can be found in @UUID[.BI9Az7GTotdCw1tB]{area 6}. When cast using the circle, the spell summons only a Land spirit (which resembles a wolf) and doesn’t require Concentration, instead lasting for the full duration. Once the circle has been used to cast the spell, it can’t be used this way again for [[/r 2d4]] days.

Vault.name: Vault
Vault.text:
This room is in Darkness. The description below assumes the characters have a light source or other means of seeing in Darkness:

A table crowded with bottles and jars stands in the center of this small, round chamber.

This was Lethchauntos’s secure vault, where he kept various treasures and expensive Material components.

Treasure. Two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgPotionOfHeali]{Potions of Healing} stand on the table. In addition, three jars contain valuable Material components. The first contains 50 GP worth of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifJadeDust00000]{jade dust}. The second contains 100 GP worth of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifGoldDust00000]{gold dust}. The third contains 200 GP worth of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifRubyDust00000]{ruby dust}.

Meditation Alcove.name: Meditation Alcove
Meditation Alcove.text:
This room is in Darkness. The description below assumes the characters have a light source or other means of seeing in Darkness:

An old pillow rests on a reed mat in the center of this long, narrow chamber. Near the mat lies a small cloth bag.

Lethchauntos used this room to meditate before performing magic in @UUID[.XfpPQxL4c04tL4MD]{area 9}. The latch that opens the secret door in the southeast corner is locked. The key to this lock is in Lethchauntos’s chamber (@UUID[.L3GJCVc6JRD6jLZh]{area 17}).

Treasure. The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifClothBag00000]{cloth bag} contains rune stones marked with letters in the Orc language. They’re worth a total of 25 GP and can be used as the Material component for the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAugury0000]{Augury} spell.

Sitting Room.name: 客厅
Sitting Room.text:
When approaching a door to this room, characters with a [[/skill perception 12 passive format=long]] hear three voices chatting in Common. The voices discuss their friend Erik, who went to use the privy in @UUID[.1mU5e4N5A6eqX4Yz]{area 15} but hasn’t returned. (Erik was eaten by the mimic now lurking in @UUID[.filc04ITgRpkiWeE]{area 13}). Read or paraphrase the following:

In this simple room, three humans sit around a table littered with a pile of coins. One of the three has dice in their hand, and the others watch expectantly. A fourth chair at the table is empty.

Three human Zhents (Medium @UUID[Actor.aif2ZhentilarSol]{Zhentilar Soldiers}; see chapter 9) gamble at the table. When the characters open a door into the room, the Zhents see them, grab weapons, and initiate combat.

Treasure. The Zhents’ wealth lies on the table: [[/award 10gp 7ep 50sp]].

Powell’s Bedroom.name: Powell’s Bedroom
Powell’s Bedroom.text:
A single bed fills one corner of this small room, a chest at its foot. A desk with a chair stands in the southeast corner. In the southwest corner stands a short, bulging, colorfully painted armoire.

Powell claimed this bedroom for herself. What she doesn’t know is the armoire is a shape-shifted @UUID[Actor.aifMimic00000000]{Mimic}. This creature was hiding in the privy (@UUID[.1mU5e4N5A6eqX4Yz]{area 15}) but moved here after murdering Erik, one of Powell’s Zhentarim soldiers, and devouring the corpse.

A character who takes a Search action to inspect the room and succeeds on a [[/skill 10 perception]] check spots streaks of blood on the armoire’s surface and in the entrance to the room.

The mimic begins combat if a creature touches it. Otherwise, the mimic remains in the shape of an armoire, digesting its meal, unless the characters begin combat with it.

Treasure. Powell has put some of her belongings in the chest. Most of these items are of no value, but a leather scroll case contains a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifSpellScrollId]{Spell Scroll of Identify}, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifSpellScrollLo]{Spell Scroll of Locate Object}, and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifPearl00000000]{pearl} worth 100 GP.

Empty Bedroom.name: Empty Bedroom
Empty Bedroom.text:
A single bed fills one corner of this small room, a chest at its foot. A desk with a chair stands in the southeast corner. The air smells old and stale.

This bedroom is empty. Its furnishings are identical to those in @UUID[.filc04ITgRpkiWeE]{area 13}, with the exception of the armoire.

Neither Powell nor her followers have reason to enter this room. The party can rest here undisturbed if they keep quiet.

Privy.name: Privy
Privy.text:
This small, dank chamber has a sitting-level wooden plank with a hole at its center. Blood is spattered across the floor and walls.

The mimic in @UUID[.filc04ITgRpkiWeE]{area 13} hid here earlier. When Erik, one of Powell’s Zhentarim allies, took a privy break, the mimic killed and devoured him before moving to area 13.

A character who takes a Search action to trace the bloodstains and succeeds on a [[/skill 10 survival]] check can follow the trail of blood to area 13.

Gallery.name: Gallery
Gallery.text:
The walls of this large, spacious chamber are decorated with frescoes that depict a venerable orc in black robes. The long, curving northeast wall shows the orc forging a peculiar axe with blades on both ends. The southern wall shows the same orc stocking a grand library with books. Finally, the west wall depicts the orc scribing a book filled with magical runes. An actual book identical to the one in the fresco rests face-out on a shelf on this wall, blending with the painting. Six columns support the ceiling.

A tall, thin human in a voluminous cloak inspects the book on the shelf, while an armed human looks on. A few bored goblins wander among the columns.

The book on the shelf is the Nathlum. The tall, thin human is Powell “the Owl” (Medium, Neutral Evil @UUID[Actor.aifMageApprentic]{Mage Apprentice;} knows the Goblin language). She recognizes the Nathlum but is afraid to touch it, suspecting the book is trapped. Powell is accompanied by a human Zhentarim bodyguard (Medium @UUID[Actor.aif2ZhentilarSol]{Zhentilar Soldier;} see chapter 9) and three @UUID[Actor.aifGoblinWarrior]{Goblin Warriors}.

If she or her followers detect the party, Powell turns to the characters and speaks:

“You must be working for Myrna,” the tall human says, blinking slowly at you with wide eyes. “Well, congratulations. It’s really quite remarkable you’ve gotten this far. But I haven’t come all this way to surrender the Nathlum now. Leave now, and consider yourselves lucky.”

If the characters don’t retreat, Powell and her followers initiate combat.

Powell attempts to flee if her Zhentarim bodyguard is killed. She heads for @UUID[.xDxs2mY5CkVI6yg6]{area 12}, where she expects to find more Zhentarim allies. If that proves impossible or if the soldiers in area 12 are dead, she flees the dungeon instead. If the characters prevent Powell’s escape or she is reduced to 10 Hit Points or fewer, she surrenders.

Treasure. The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifNathlum000000]{Nathlum} rests on a shelf on the west wall; see “The Nathlum” later in this chapter for details on the book. Powell has [[/award 15gp]] in a belt pouch. The Zhentarim bodyguard has [[/award 10gp]], and the goblins have [[/award 1d6*3gp]] each.

Lethchauntos’s Chamber.name: Lethchauntos’s Chamber
Lethchauntos’s Chamber.text:
This room is in Darkness. Powell and her followers haven’t yet investigated it. The description below assumes the characters have a light source or other means of seeing in Darkness:

This handsome bedchamber is decorated all in black, with black tapestries lining the walls, a black canopy over a large enclosed bed, and a stout black wooden bed stand. A black armoire stands in one corner.

This was Lethchauntos’s bedroom. A journal, written in the Orc language, lies in a drawer in the bed stand. The journal relates the information from “Lethchauntos’s Tragic Life.”

Treasure. The armoire is filled with robes and other black clothing. On a shelf in the armoire is a key that opens the doors to @UUID[.LeYe5Z7eXnWD4lrY]{areas 11} and @UUID[.fB3IfDXo3BP8LZ2t]{19}, as well as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifPlatinumRing0]{platinum ring} worth 50 GP. This was Lethchauntos’s wedding ring, and it matches the ring in @UUID[.fB3IfDXo3BP8LZ2t]{area 19}.

Forge.name: Forge
Forge.text:
This room is in Darkness. Powell hasn’t come here yet. The description below assumes the characters have a light source or other means of seeing in Darkness:

This long, narrow room was once a forge, but its fires are long cold. An anvil stands at the far end, and hammers, tongs, and other tools hang from a rack on one wall. Resting on the anvil is a greataxe.

This was Lethchauntos’s forge. He used it to forge the greataxe resting on the anvil.

Treasure. The axe has a long, straight haft with a metal grip and a leather loop at the end. The double-bladed axe head is symmetrical and angular, each blade resembling a giant arrowhead. The axe is @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifLethchauntoss]{Lethchauntos’s Legacy}, a sentient +1 Greataxe. Lethchauntos’s Legacy has Intelligence 10, Wisdom 16, and Charisma 13, and it is Neutral Good. It communicates by transmitting emotion to the creature carrying it, and it has hearing and Darkvision out to 120 feet. The axe has a special purpose: to protect the family of its bearer. The axe considers especially close friends to be “found family” under its protection. The axe hasn’t been touched since Lethchauntos placed it here centuries ago, and it doesn’t know where its creator is now.

Chasm.name: Chasm
Chasm.text:
The door to this room is locked; the key is in @UUID[.L3GJCVc6JRD6jLZh]{Area 17}. This area is in Darkness. The description below assumes the characters have a light source or other means of seeing in Darkness:

A wide ledge extends into darkness. Beyond, a chasm stretches to the southeast. In the empty space, two small, circular platforms hang suspended by chains. On the far side of the chasm is another rocky ledge, where a small headstone stands.

Lethchauntos buried his wife at the south end of this chasm. That was long ago, however, and now the chasm is home to monstrous spiders.

Webs. A thick layer of sticky webs created by spiders spreads across the chasm 70 feet below the ledge. A creature that can see in Darkness can see these webs from the ledge. A creature that falls from the ledge or platforms (see below) lands in the webs, taking no damage from the fall. A creature that lands in the webs or starts its turn there must succeed on a [[/save 13 dexterity]] or have the Restrained condition until the web in that creature’s space is destroyed. Each 5-foot square of web has AC 10, HP 5, Vulnerability to Fire damage, and Immunity to Psychic and Poison damage.

Spiders. This chasm is a home to two @UUID[Actor.aifGiantSpider00]{Giant Spiders} and two swarms of spiders (@UUID[Actor.aifSwarmOfInsect]{Swarms of Insects}). The giant spiders lurk on the webs below the platforms (see below), while the swarms hide at the south end of the chasm. The spiders ambush any creature that falls into the web or reaches the south end of the chasm.

Platforms. Three platforms used to bridge this chasm, but the middle platform collapsed long ago, leaving a treacherous space between the remaining two platforms. A creature that tries to leap between the platforms makes a [[/skill 12 acrobatics]] check, falling into the webs below on a failed check.

Climbing Up. Climbing back up to the entrance or grave site from the webs below without a Climb speed requires a successful [[/skill 10 athletics]] check. Creatures that fail this check fall back onto the webs. Once the spiders have been defeated, creatures climb back to safety without needing to make a check.

Grave Site. The cliff on the far side of the chasm is home to a grave site. A simple square granite tombstone reads, in the Orc language, “Ona, Beloved Wife.” Lethchauntos’s wife is buried here.

The tunnel leading south from the grave site eventually leads to the Underdark, but that is beyond the scope of this adventure.

Treasure. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifPlatinumRing0]{platinum ring }rests on the gravestone. The ring is worth 50 GP and is identical to the ring in @UUID[.L3GJCVc6JRD6jLZh]{area 17}.

Calim Crossing.name: Calim Crossing
Calim Crossing.description:
A Location (Calimshan) Adventure for

Level 3 Characters

Brave the dangers of the Calim Desert.

Situation. Shezar Han, a human merchant (Medium, Neutral Good Commoner), must take his caravan from Memnon to Calimport, a weeklong journey of over 150 miles. But his guards are monsters in disguise intending to lure the caravan to its destruction.

Hook. Shezar hires the characters to escort his caravan to Calimport. He offers each character 100 GP now and another 100 GP when the caravan reaches its destination.

Commoner.name: 平民
Commoner.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepClub000000]{Club}

Commoner

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.M7bvUVFcncRjraJP caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Training.name: 技艺受训
Training.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 具有某项技能熟练（由DM选择），且在进行使用该技能的属性检定时具有优势。

Jackalwere.name: 化形胡狼
Jackalwere.description:
化形胡狼

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.x6cBtZATrxEVlOiZ caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Pack Tactics.name: 集群战术
Pack Tactics.description: 若 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 的攻击目标生物周围 5 尺范围内存在有至少一个 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 未失能的盟友，则 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 对该生物进行的攻击检定具有优势。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 发动两次 [[/item .mmRend0000000000]]{撕裂}或 [[/item .mmSlam0000000000]]{猛击}攻击。

Rend (Jackal or Hybrid Form Only).name: 撕裂（仅胡狼与混合形态）

Slam (Human or Hybrid Form Only).name: 猛击（仅人类与混合形态）

Sleep Gaze.name: 昏睡凝视
Sleep Gaze.description:
感知豁免检定： DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]]，单一[[lookup @range.value activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]] 尺内 [[lookup @name lowcase]] 可见的生物（此豁免构装和亡灵自动成功）。

失败： 目标陷入 [[lookup @labels.duration activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]] 的 &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] 状态，持续 10 分钟，目标身上的此效应在其受到伤害或被目标 5 尺内的另一生物用一个动作摇醒时提前结束。

成功： 目标在 24 小时内免疫此 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 昏睡凝视。

Unconscious.name: 昏迷
Unconscious.description: 你陷入 &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] 状态，持续 10 分钟，此效应在你受到伤害或被 5 尺内的另一生物用一个动作摇醒时提前结束。

Shape-Shift.name: 变形
Shape-Shift.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 变形为中型的人类或类人与胡狼的混合形态（中型），或变回其真实形态（即小型胡狼）。除体型以外，其各形态下游戏数据均相同化形胡狼着装或携带的任何装备都不会随之变化。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 发动两次 [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] 攻击。其可以将其中一次攻击替换为使用 [[/item .mmCorruptingTouc]]。

Corrupting Touch.name: 腐化触击
Corrupting Touch.description:
感知豁免检定： DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=F4cByCi1IEouN08a]]，单一 [[lookup @range.value activity=F4cByCi1IEouN08a]] 尺内 [[lookup @name lowercase]]可见的生物。

失败： [[/damage average]] 伤害，且目标被诅咒，持续1小时。目标陷入 &Reference[Charmed apply=false] 与 &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] 状态。

Cursed, Charmed & Poisoned.name: 诅咒，魅惑并中毒
Cursed, Charmed & Poisoned.description: 直至诅咒结束，你陷入 &Reference[Charmed apply=false] 与 &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] 状态，直至拉迷亚的下一回合结束。

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self} (can appear as a Large or Medium biped), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGeas000000]{Geas}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}

Leap.name: 跳跃
Leap.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @activation.condition activity=C28C43DeD8iFtZMe]] 跳跃至多 [[lookup @range.value activity=C28C43DeD8iFtZMe]] 尺。

Disguise Self.name: 易容术
Disguise Self.description:
你改变自身以及随身的衣物、护甲、武器等在你身上的所有物。该效应在法术终止时结束。肉眼看来你的身高可以有 1 尺的增减，体态可胖可瘦。你必须选择一个和你肢体基础排列方式一致的形态。此外，幻术的影响范围由你决定。

此法术产生的变化无法应对物理检查。比如，你用此法术添了一顶帽子，那么现实物件会从帽子穿过去，且任何触碰帽子的人将摸不到任何东西。

如果一名生物想要分辨你是否易容，则必须使用一个研究动作研究你的外貌，并成功于一次对抗你法术豁免DC的 [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] 检定。

Disguised.name: 乔装
Disguised.description: 一名生物想要分辨你是否易容，则必须使用一个研究动作研究你的外貌，并成功于一次对抗你法术豁免DC的 [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] 检定。

Minor Illusion.name: 次级幻象
Minor Illusion.description:
你在施法距离内创造一段声响或一个物件的影像，并使之维持至法术持续时间结束，详见以下对应效应的描述。你可以再次施展该法术来终止幻象。

生物用研究动作调查该声响或影像时，其必须进行一次对抗该法术豁免 DC 的[[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]]检定，检定成功则判断出是幻象。对于识破幻象的生物而言，幻象会变得模糊不清。

声响。 如果你创造一段声响，其音量可以是低声耳语也可以是高声尖叫。它可以是你或其他任何人的嗓音，或者是一头狮子的咆哮、一段鼓声以及任何你指定的其他声响。声响在持续时间内不会减弱，或者你也可以于法术终止前在不同的时间段创造几段分散的声响。

影像。 如果你创造一个物件的影像，比如一把椅子、泥泞的脚印、一个小箱子等，则该物件各方向上大小不得大于 5 尺立方区域。该影像不具有声音、光亮、味道或任何其他的感官效应。由于影像可以被任何物体穿透，因此与之进行物理互动时都会揭露其幻象的本质。

Geas.name: 指使术
Geas.description:
你对施法距离内你能看见的一个生物下达一条魔法口头命令，并强迫其执行相应的某种服务或克制某种行为，或者遵照你的要求行动。目标必须成功通过一次感知豁免，否则将在法术持续时间内陷入 &Reference[Charmed apply=false] 状态。目标不能理解你的命令，则其在豁免中自动成功。

被魅惑生物每次做出与你的命令相悖的行为时，即受到 [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]]伤害。该伤害一日至多生效一次。

除了涉及导致必死结果的行为外，你向目标下达的任何命令都会生效。如果你发布自杀指令则法术即时终止。

一道 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]、 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes] 或 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000] 可以终止该法术。

升环施法： 使用七环或八环法术位施展该法术时，持续时间变为 365 日。使用九环法术位施展该法术时，法术将一直持续至被上文提及的法术所终止。

Under Orders.name: 遵循指示
Under Orders.description: 当陷入 &Reference[Charmed apply=false] 时, 你做出与施法者命令相悖的行为时，即受到 [[/damage 5d10 type=psyhic]] 伤害。该伤害一日至多生效一次。

Major Image.name: 高等幻影
Major Image.description:
你创造一个影像，其形象来自一个大小不超过边长 20 尺立方体的物件或生物，或是其他的可视现象。影像出现在施法距离内你能看见的一处位置并在法术持续时间内维持存在。它看起来完全是真实的，并且还具有相应的声音、气味和温度。但它无法造成伤害或让人陷入任何状态。

在该幻象施法距离内时，你可以用一个魔法动作将影像移动到施法距离内的另一个位置。影像改变位置时，你可以改变影像的外表来使它移动得更自然。例如，如果你创造了一个生物的影像并移动它，则你可以改变影像，使它看起来就像是在走路。或者你也可以让影像在不同的时间发出不同的声音，甚至可以让它参与一场对话。

由于影像可以被穿过，任何与该影像进行的物理互动都会暴露其幻象的本质。一个生物用研究动作调查影像时，它可以进行一次对抗你的法术豁免 DC 的 [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] 检定，以判定是否看穿幻象。辨出幻象的生物可以看破该影像，而影像的其他感官效应在该生物看来会变得微弱而模糊。

升环施法： 使用高于三环的法术位时，法术时间持续至被解除且无需专注。

Scrying.name: 探知术
Scrying.description:
你能看见和听见一个和你处于同一存在位面上的生物。目标生物必须进行一次感知豁免；该豁免的调整值与你对目标的了解程度有关（见下文），也与你和目标之间的物理联系程度有关。目标不知道它进行此豁免在对抗什么，只是会感觉不自在。

你对目标的了解有… 豁免调整值
二手信息（你曾经听说过目标） +5
直接信息（你曾经见过目标） +0
熟悉（你对目标很了解） −5
你持有目标的… 豁免调整值
肖像或其他图像 −2
衣物或其他物品 −4
身体部位如头发或指甲 −10

如果对方豁免成功，则目标不受该法术影响，并且在 24 小时内你不能尝试探知同一个目标。

如果对方豁免失败，则你在目标身边 10 尺内创造出一个隐形的传感器。通过传感器，你可以身临其境地看见和听见周围的环境。传感器会跟随目标移动，并在法术持续时间内始终保持在目标 10 尺之内。在能够看到传感器的生物眼中，你的传感器是一个拳头大小的光球。

除生物之外，你也可以选择一个你以前见过的地点作为该法术的目标。这种情况下，传感器会出现在目标地点且不会移动。

materials.value: 一个至少价值 1000GP 的法器，例如水晶球、银镜、圣水盆

affects.special: 与你处于同一位面的生物，或某个你曾见过的地点的生物

Warrior Veteran.name: 历战武者
Warrior Veteran.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatsword]{Greatsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepHeavyCross]{Heavy Crossbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmSplintArmo]{Splint Armor}

Warriors

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.3Il3CvacAVpf6Rch caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 发动两次 [[/item .KkRkIIhD17sL5x30]] 或 [[/item .0nNkeR6HNC1e2uQ3]]攻击。

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description:
触发： [[lookup @name lowercase]]在持握武器期间因近战攻击检定被命中。

响应： [[lookup @name lowercase]] 其对抗那次攻击时的AC +[[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]（可能令那次攻击失手）。

Use.name: 使用
Use.condition: 在持握武器期间因近战攻击检定被命中

Pack Tactics.name: 集群战术
Pack Tactics.description: 若 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 的攻击目标生物周围 5 尺范围内存在有至少一个 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 未失能的盟友，则 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 对该生物进行的攻击检定具有优势。

Running Leap.name: 助跑起跳
Running Leap.description: [[lookup @name locase]]在助跑 10 尺后可以跳远至多 25 尺。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 发动两次 [[/item .mmRend0000000000]] 攻击。其可以将其中一次攻击替换为使用 [[/item .mmRoar0000000000]]。

Roar.name: 咆哮
Roar.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Igeu89TALGlNPXDg]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=Igeu89TALGlNPXDg]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Frightened.name: 恐慌
Frightened.description: 你陷入 &Reference[Frightened apply=false] 状态直至狮子的下一回合开始。

Paralyzed.name: 麻痹
Paralyzed.description: 你陷入 &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] 状态，并在你回合结束时重复豁免，成功则终止你身上的该效应。1 分钟后，你的豁免自动成功。

Prone.name: 倒地
Prone.description: 你陷入 &Reference[Prone apply=false] 状态。

Water Bound.name: 水体绑定
Water Bound.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]]与某处水体绑定，若其离开了那处水体或是那处水体被摧毁，水诡将死亡。

Invisible in Water.name: 水融一体
Invisible in Water.description: 若完全浸入水中，[[lookup @name lowercase]] 处于 &Reference[Invisible] 状态。

Surge.name: 浪涌
Surge.description: [[/attack extended]]。 [[/damage average extended]]。若目标生物体型不超过中型，则其陷入 &Reference[Grappled apply=false]状态（逃脱 DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]），且目标陷入 &Reference[Restrained apply=false] 状态，直至擒抱结束。

Grappled & Restrained.name: 受擒并束缚
Grappled & Restrained.description: 若你的体型不超过中型，则陷入 &Reference[Grappled apply=false] 状态（逃脱DC 13，[[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]]），且目标陷入 &Reference[Restrained apply=false] 状态，直至擒抱结束。

Fire Aura.name: 炽焰灵光
Fire Aura.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 回合结束时位于源自 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 的[[lookup @target.template.size activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]] 尺光环区域内的所有生物受到 [[/damage average]] 伤害。光环内的生物和易燃物件开始燃烧。

Fire Form.name: 火焰形态
Fire Form.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 可以移动穿过最窄 1 寸宽的空间而无需消耗额外的移动力，且其可以进入并停留在一名生物所处的空间。当 [[lookup @name lowercase]] 回合中首次进入某生物所处的空间时，该生物受到 [[/damage average]]伤害。

Illumination.name: 照明
Illumination.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 散发出半径 30 尺的明亮光照以及额外 30 尺的微光光照。

Water Susceptibility.name: 水体易感
Water Susceptibility.description:
每在水中移动 5 尺，或者每被泼一加仑水， [[lookup @name lowercase]] 就受到[[/damage 1d6 type=cold average]]伤害。

Foundry Note

比例值设定为根据在水中行进的距离来投掷相应数量的骰子。默认值为 5 尺 1 次，10 尺 2 次，以此类推。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 发动两次 [[/item .mmBurn0000000000]] 攻击。

Burn.name: 燃烧
Burn.description: [[/attack extended]]。[[/damage average extended]]。 若目标为生物或和易燃物件，则其开始&Reference[burning]。

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Calimshan) Adventure for

Level 3 Characters

Brave the dangers of the Calim Desert.

Scenes: @UUID[Scene.dmgCaravanEncamp]{Caravan Encampment}, @UUID[Scene.dmgWizardsTower0]{Wizard’s Tower}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.eRgFLdd3IYvUvmm5]{Calim Crossing}

Situation. Shezar Han, a human merchant (Medium, Neutral Good @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoner}), must take his caravan from Memnon to Calimport, a weeklong journey of over 150 miles. But his guards are monsters in disguise intending to lure the caravan to its destruction.

Hook. Shezar hires the characters to escort his caravan to Calimport. He offers the characters [[/award each 100gp]] now and another [[/award each 100gp]] when the caravan reaches its destination.

Encounters

This adventure takes place over a week as the caravan follows the Trade Way south across the desert. The caravan includes dozens of camels carrying precious goods, but Shezar’s prize possession is a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifBrazierofComm]{Brazier of Commanding Fire Elementals,} which he keeps packed away on his camel.

Shezar has hired eight guards aside from the characters; he doesn’t know they’re @UUID[Actor.mmJackalwere0000]{Jackalweres} in humanoid form. Their leader is named Thukir. Thukir and the other jackalweres work for a @UUID[Actor.aifLamia00000000]{Lamia} named Selim who covets Shezar’s magic brazier. Shezar assigns Thukir and the other guards to remain with the caravan every day while the characters scout the path ahead.

Desert Encounters. Each day, as the characters scout, roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncCalimDeser]{Calim Desert Encounters} table. The characters spot any encounters from far off, so they can flee from threats too dangerous for them to handle and redirect the caravan along a safer route.

Jackalwere Treason. The “guards” keep to themselves and avoid interacting with the characters. Thukir does the talking for the group. The jackalweres maintain their deception for as long as possible, but if they sense the party is onto them, they try to ambush the party one night in camp. Use the @UUID[Scene.dmgCaravanEncamp]{Caravan Encampment }map in appendix B of the Dungeon Master’s Guide for this encounter, replacing the wagons with bundles of goods offloaded from the caravan’s camels.

Sandstorm. On the fourth day, a furious Calim sandstorm (see “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifDesertSurviva.JournalEntryPage.KJvjdQTQMmNOvQLN]{Environmental Effects”} earlier in this chapter) approaches the caravan. The characters can seek shelter for the caravan or, failing that, shelter in place. If the jackalweres haven’t yet been revealed, they try to steal the brazier. Should the jackalweres get the brazier toward Selim’s tower (see below).

Selim Strikes. The @UUID[Actor.aifLamia00000000]{Lamia} Selim lairs in a desert tower near the south end of the Trade Way. On the second-to-last night of the journey, Selim sneaks up to the camp and steals the brazier. If the jackalweres haven’t yet been confronted, they join with Selim to seize the camp. Shezar begs the characters to recover the brazier from the lamia.

Selim’s Tower. Use the @UUID[Scene.dmgWizardsTower0]{Wizard’s Tower} map in the Dungeon Master’s Guide for Selim’s lair. The tower entrance on level 1 is guarded by a @UUID[Actor.aifWarriorVetera]{Warrior Veteran }and their pet @UUID[Actor.mmLion0000000000]{Lion}. Replace the central chamber on level 2 with a pool housing a @UUID[Actor.mmWaterWeird0000]{Water Weird} Selim has imprisoned. Selim is on level 4, along with a @UUID[Actor.aifFireElemental]{Fire Elemental} he’s summoned using the brazier.

Conclusion. When the party brings Shezar safely to Calimport, he pays them the promised reward and gives them the magic brazier, insisting it has brought him nothing but woe and misfortune.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.aEewjd28aKSjtuBh caption=false]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.EoOSGpQIgcWDR9O5 caption=false]

Rescue a man from desperate bandits.

Situation. Bandits have settled into ruined towers flanking a road within a day’s travel of Baldur’s Gate. Now they stop travelers and demand a toll. They’ve even taken prisoners, demanding ransoms for the prisoners’ release.

Situation. Bandits have settled into ruined towers flanking a road within a day’s travel of Baldur’s Gate. Now they stop travelers and demand a toll. They’ve even taken prisoners, demanding ransoms for the prisoners’ release.

Hook. A middle-aged human trader named Rolf Twyrtho (Medium Commoner) has received a ransom note for his brother Adon, held by the bandits. Rolf offers each character 50GP to bring Adon home and teach the bandits a lesson.

Training.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 具有某项技能熟练（由DM选择），且在进行使用该技能的属性检定时具有优势。

Cunning Action.name: 灵巧动作
Cunning Action.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 执行 &Reference[Dash apply=false]、&Reference[Disengage apply=false] 或 &Reference[Hide apply=false] 动作。

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Divine Aid.name: 至圣援护
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: 祝福术
Bless.description:
你祝福施法范围内至多 3 个生物。在法术终止前，每当受术目标进行攻击检定或豁免检定时，都可以在检定结果中额外加入 1d4。

升环施法： 使用高于一环的法术位施展此法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，就能多指定一个生物。

Blessed.name: 祝福
Blessed.description: 在法术终止前，每当你进行攻击检定或豁免检定时，都可以在检定结果中额外加入 1d4。

Healing Word.name: 治愈真言
Healing Word.description:
你指定施法距离内一个你能看见的生物并恢复其生命值，恢复量等于 2d4 + 你的施法属性调整值。

升环施法： 使用高于一环的法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，治疗量就增加 2d4 点。

Sanctuary.name: 庇护术
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Warded.name: 庇护
Warded.description:
在法术终止前，任何试图对受保护者进行攻击或对受保护者施放伤害性法术的生物都必须成功通过一次[[/save ability=wis format=long]]豁免，若豁免失败，该生物必须选定一个新目标，否则将失去本次的攻击或法术。

若受保护生物发动一次攻击，施展一道法术，或是造成任何伤害，则该法术随之终止。

Light.name: 光亮术
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

materials.value: 一只萤火虫或一片磷光苔藓

Thaumaturgy.name: 奇术
Thaumaturgy.description:
你在施法距离内显现一道次级奇迹。你在施法距离内创造下述效应之一。如果你多次施展该法术，则可以同时维持至多三个不同的持续 1 分钟的效应。

改变眼睛。 你改变自己眼睛的外观，其效应持续 1 分钟。

扩音。 你的声音变为一般时候的三倍，其效应持续 1 分钟。在此期间，你在 [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] 检定上具有优势。

玩火。 你使一团火焰闪烁，变亮，变暗或变色，其效应持续 1 分钟。

无形之手。 你使一扇没有锁上的门或窗立即打开或关上。

幻音。 你使一阵瞬时声音自施法距离内一点发出，例如雷鸣声，渡鸦叫声或不祥低语声。

震动。 你在地面上引发无害的震动，其效应持续 1 分钟。
